timeline.summary: This document is a redacted U.S. Passport record for Jeffrey Edward Epstein. The passport was issued by the U.S. Department of Homeland Security’s Customs and Border Protection on May 31, 2016, with an expiration date of May 30, 2020. The record includes his last name, first name, date of birth, gender, and nationality. The document is marked as “For Official Use Only / Law Enforcement Sensitive.”

On September 28, 2016, the FBI drafted Form FD-1057 regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein, a convicted Child Sex Offender. Epstein planned to travel to France from September 24, 2016, departing on October 5, 2016, arriving at Le Bourget Airport in Paris at approximately 8:30 pm on September 24, 2016. Epstein's prior conviction involved procuring a person under 18 for prostitution (June 30, 2008). The FBI provided this notification to Legal Paris as an advisory. Epstein’s details include DOB: 1/20/1953, height 6’0”, weight 180 lbs, gray hair, blue eyes, and passport number 516923892. No immediate action was required.

On June 2, 2018, at 7:00 AM, a private air flight (INSUM2JE) departed from KPBI. The manifest included Jeffrey Edward EPSTEIN (USA, M), David Neville RODGERS (USA, M), and Lawrence Paul VISOSKI (USA, M). The documents associated with these travelers were flagged with statuses including NCIC, SEC, PSBS, I, FARE, FDOC, FOUT, and C. The document is classified as “For Official Use Only / Law Enforcement Sensitive” and identified as EFTA00037626.

On October 10, 2018, at 07:00, Jeffrey Edward Epstein, Darren Lee Jell, and Lawrence Paul Visoski traveled privately by aircraft (N212JE) from KPBI to an unspecified destination. The traveler list was generated by U.S. Customs and Border Protection on April 23, 2019, and includes traveler details such as names, dates of birth, countries of origin, and travel status (Fair, FDO, FOUT). The document is marked as "For Official Use Only / Law Enforcement Sensitive" and assigned the identifier EFTA00037623.

On October 28, 2018, at 07:30 EDT, a private flight (N212JE) departed from Attica, Greece, carrying seven travelers. The travelers were: Jeffrey Edward Epstein, David Neville Rodgers, Paul Lawrence, and one unidentified individual. The data was generated by U.S. Customs and Border Protection and included traveler names, dates of birth, and associated identification codes (NCIC, SEC).

On October 30, 2018, Jeffrey Edward Epstein, David Neville Rodgers, and Lawrence Paul Visoski Jr. arrived at TIST via private air. The traveler list was generated by U.S. Customs and Border Protection. All three individuals were traveling from the USA. ESTA status for all travelers was APPROVED. No EVUS or other error status was indicated.

Jeffrey Edward Epstein was housed in Special Housing Unit Cell Z04.206LAD at New York MCC from April 6, 2019, to ongoing. The record details his shifts, meals, exercise, and out-of-cell time, with medical staff documenting observations and providing medication. Pertinent information regarding his medical conditions (epileptic, diabetic, suicidal, assaultive) and other details are redacted. The record is maintained by the U.S. Department of Justice, Federal Bureau of Prisons, and is updated daily by medical staff and the OIC.

On April 14, 2019, at 1:28 EDT, a private air flight (N212JE) arrived at KPBI carrying three travelers: Jeffrey Edward Epstein, David Neville Rodgers, and Darren Lee Rotnell. All three travelers were United States citizens, and ESTA was not required for any of them. One traveler, Darren Lee Rotnell, had an approved EVUS status. This information was generated by U.S. Customs and Border Protection.

This document is a Special Housing Unit record for inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein (BP-A0292) admitted on April 16, 2019, to the New York MCC. It details his placement in SHU Cell Z04.206LAD, medication status (yes), and medical examinations conducted on various dates and times, recorded by medical staff. The record includes notations regarding out-of-cell time, meals, and inmate conduct. It’s a daily log maintained by U.S. Department of Justice Federal Bureau of Prisons staff.

On April 23, 2019, a Traveler List was generated by U.S. Customs and Border Protection detailing information for three travelers: Jeffrey Edward Epstein, David Neville Rodgers, and Lawrence Paul Visoski. The list includes departure dates (May 13, 2018), departure locations (IKTEB and LFPB), traveler names, dates of birth, gender, document types, document numbers, countries of origin (USA), and traveler status codes (NCIC;PRI, SBS;III;FAIR;FDO, SBS;III;FAIR;FDOC;FOUT, and CR1). The list is marked as “For Official Use Only / Law Enforcement Sensitive” and assigned the identifier EFTA00037625.

On April 23, 2019, U.S. Customs and Border Protection generated a Traveler List (TECS - Advance Traveler Information) for manifest ID 8215636629. The list details travel information for Jeffrey Edward Epstein, David Neville Rodgers, and Lawrence Paul Visoski Jr., including flight details (N212JE), arrival and departure dates/locations, traveler names, dates of birth, ESTA/EVUS status, and whether a traveler’s record is required. The document is marked “For Official Use Only / Law Enforcement Sensitive.”

This document is a Traveler List generated by U.S. Customs and Border Protection on April 23, 2019, pertaining to air arrivals. It details travel information for three individuals: Jeffrey Edward Epstein, David Neville Rodgers, and Lawrence Paul Visoski Jr., including arrival times, locations (KPBI and TIST), traveler details (name, date of birth, gender, ESTA status, and country of citizenship), and associated documentation types. The document indicates that ESTA was not required for all travelers.

On April 23, 2019, U.S. Customs and Border Protection generated a Traveler List (EFTA00037621) detailing travel information for three individuals: Jeffrey Edward Epstein, David Neville Rodgers, and Lawrence Paul Visoski Jr. The list includes flight details (N212JE, Private Air), arrival and departure locations (KPBI), dates (06/15/2018), names, dates of birth, document types, countries of origin, genders, travel statuses, ESTA statuses, and EVUS statuses.  Notably, all three travelers' ESTA requirements were not required.

On April 23, 2019, U.S. Customs and Border Protection created a Traveler List (EFTA00037616) detailing travel information for three individuals: Jeffrey Edward Epstein, David Neville Rodgers, and Lawrence Paul Visoski Jr. The list includes travel dates (August 6, 2018), modes of travel (Private Air), arrival and departure locations, document types, document numbers, countries of origin (USA), genders, ESTA status (Not Required for all), and EVUS status (Not Required).

On April 23, 2019, at 13:01 EDT, U.S. Customs and Border Protection generated a Traveler List (EFTA00037608) for a private air journey involving travelers Jeffrey Edward Epstein, David Neville Rodgers, and Lawrence Paul Visoski. The travelers’ modes of travel were Tads/IC (N212JE) and arrived at IKISP on June 2, 2018, departing from TIST. All three travelers are USA citizens, male, and their ESTA status was “Not Required”.

On April 23, 2019, U.S. Customs and Border Protection generated a Traveler List (TECS - Advance Traveler Information) regarding manifest ID 8218062410. The list details travel information for four individuals: Jeffrey Edward Epstein, Charles Lewis Pickett III, Holly Ann Van Heemst, and Lawrence Paul Visoski.  Each entry includes name, date of birth, document type, country, gender, ESTA status, and EVUS status.  The list also indicates whether MDT or CRW requirements are needed for each traveler.

This document is a Traveler List generated by U.S. Customs and Border Protection on April 23, 2019, pertaining to a private air flight (Manifest ID: 8214559653). It details the arrival and departure information, traveler names (Jeffrey Edward Epstein, Charles Lewis Pickett III, David Neville Rodgers, Lawrence Paul Visoski Jr.), dates, locations, countries, genders, ESTA/EVUS statuses, and whether travel requires authorization. The document indicates that all listed travelers were either approved or not required for travel.

On April 23, 2019, at 16:01 EDT, U.S. Customs and Border Protection generated a Traveler List from private air travel data. The list includes information for Jeffrey Edward Epstein, David Neville Rodgers, and Lawrence Paul Visoski Jr., detailing their arrival and departure locations, travel documents, countries of origin, gender, ESTA/EVUS status, and whether they require a visa. The list shows three records out of a total of three records. The document is designated as "For Official Use Only / Law Enforcement Sensitive."

On April 24, 2019, at 16:06 EDT, U.S. Customs and Border Protection generated a Traveler List for Manifest ID 8221795415. The list details three travelers: Jeffrey Edward Doerr, David Neville Rodgers, and Lawrence Paul Visoski. Their arrival was scheduled on December 14, 2018, at KPBI, and their respective ESTA statuses were FAIR for Doerr and Rodgers, and NOT REQUIRED for Visoski. All three travelers are from the USA.

On April 24, 2019, U.S. Customs and Border Protection recorded information for three travelers: Jeffrey Edward Epstein, David Neville Rodgers, and Lawrence Paul Visoski Jr. The data includes names, dates of birth, gender, nationality (USA), ESTA/EVUS status (approved/not required), and travel mode (Private Air). The document was generated as part of the TECS - Advance Traveler Information - Traveler List program.

On April 24, 2019, U.S. Customs and Border Protection recorded traveler information for three individuals: Jeffrey Edward Epstein, David Neville Rodgers, and Lawrence Paul Visoski. The data includes arrival times (February 8, 2019 at 18:07), arrival locations (KPBI, TIST), departure locations (USA), traveler names, dates of birth, gender, nationality (USA), document types (PAS, CRW, CR1), ESTA status (Not Required for all), and a travel status (OUT, P, PAX). The document is marked "For Official Use Only / Law Enforcement Sensitive" and identified as EFTA00037620.

On April 26, 2019, a U.S. Passport (P) was issued to Jeffrey Edward Epstein, born March 7, 2029, with a validity date of March 8, 2019. The passport was issued by the U.S. Department of Homeland Security’s U.S. Customs and Border Protection, and identified by the document number EFTA00010343. The passport status is “Issued” and “Passport.”

This document is a suicide watch log for inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg # 176318-054) within the SDNY correctional facility. It details observations recorded over several dates, primarily between July 6, 2019, and July 24, 2019. The log includes a chronological record of observations taken every 13 minutes, signed and initialed by the observer. It also contains initial information about the inmate, including their category (DS - Diagnostic Special Management) and assignment description. The document provides instructions for observers and includes a section for the chief psychologist to complete at the conclusion of the watch.

It details observations made during a watch on Inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. # 176318-054), a DS (Discipline Status) inmate. The log includes sections for initial setup, recording observations every 15 minutes, and signatures to verify the observer's shift. Multiple pages contain observation logs, detailing the inmate's behavior and the observer’s notes at various times throughout the observation period. The log uses a specific format, including a timestamped entry field and an instruction to legibly print and sign.

Jeffrey Edward Epstein’s inmate history details his quarters assignments from July 6, 2019, to August 13, 2019. These assignments occurred within various locations including NYM 204-206 LAD House Z/Range 04/Bed 206L, NYM H01-001L, NYM Z05-124 LAD House Z/Range 05/Bed 124L, NYM 202-201 LAD House Z/Range 02/Bed 201L, NYM E06-547U, and NYM A01-001L. The assignments were conducted by NYM and associated with transaction ID SDNY_00017776.

Jeffrey Edward Epstein is an inmate housed in the Special Housing Unit at the New York MCC facility, managed by the U.S. Department of Justice, Federal Bureau of Prisons. The record details his placement in cell Z05-124 LAD on 2019-07-07 at 19:20 due to a pending classification violation.  The record includes daily logs documenting his shift times, meals, exercise, out-of-cell time, medical observations (no complaints voiced), and signatures from medical staff and the OIC. The document outlines procedures for recording inmate information and medical observations within the SHU.

A psych observation was conducted on Jeffrey Edward Epstein, Reg. No. 73618-054, from July 8, 2019, at 6:00 PM to July 10, 2019, at 9:00 AM. An I/M companion was utilized during the observation.  Related documents, including a text file and a PDF, were attached.

This document concerns a psych observation conducted on Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054) from July 8, 2019, at 6:00 PM to July 10, 2019, at 9:00 AM. The observation was performed by an "I/M companion," and the file (EFTA00035061) is corrupted and unopenable. Correspondence regarding the observation was exchanged between individuals with redacted email addresses.

It includes: *   **Vision Screen (07/09/2019):**  Epstein’s vision was assessed with varying degrees of visual acuity in both distance and near vision, requiring corrective lenses. An optometrist evaluation was recommended. *   **Immunizations (07/07/2019 – 08/10/2019):** He received vaccinations against Hepatitis A & B, Measles/Mumps/Rubella, Smallpox, Tetanus, and Varicella. *   **Medical Duty Status (07/09/2019):**  His movement was restricted to the living quarters, with limited privileges including meals, pill line access, and bathroom use. He was barred from sports, weightlifting, and cardiovascular exercise. *   **Equipment:** He was permitted to have a CPAP machine. *   **Medication Summary (07/07/2019 – 08/10/2019):** He was prescribed Bisacodyl, Docusate Sodium, Milk of Magnesia, Methylprednisolone, and Omega 3. *   **Dental Health History Screen (07/26/2019):**  Dental examination revealed moderate to advanced gingival recession, crowding, and a need for possible treatment. *   **Cosign/Review (07/24/2019):**  A review of his medical treatment refusal was documented, with counseling provided. **Note:** Parts of several pages are redacted (indicated with “[REDACTED]”).

No. 76318.054) *   **Institution:** U.S. Department of Justice Federal Bureau of Prisons – New York MCC *   **Dates of Entry/Record:** Primarily July 10, 2019 - July 19, 2019 *   **Cell Location:** 205-124 LAD *   **Medical Information:** Inmate is not on medication, medical staff are notified, and documented medical observations (e.g., anemia) are recorded. *   **Shift Activity:** Records detail daily activity including meals, exercise, out-of-cell time, and medical visits. *   **Signatures:** Records require signatures from Unit Officer in Charge (OIC), Medical Staff, and potentially other personnel. *   **Notes:** Explanatory notes section includes potential medical conditions (Epileptic, Diabetic, Suicidal, Assaultive) and behavioral observations.

This is a Special Housing Unit Record for inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Rog. No. 76318.054) at the New York MCC facility. The record details his placement in SHU Cell H01-001L, medication status (N), and shift-by-shift logs including meals, exercise, out-of-cell time, medical staff observations, and OIC signatures. Pertinent information includes the inmate's medical conditions (Epileptic, Diabetic, Suicidal, Assaultive) and a standard log format for medical staff documentation.

Jeffrey Edward Epstein, Register Number 76318-054, was placed in Special Housing Unit 5 at New York MCC on July 10, 2019, due to a Pending Captains Review. A 3-day review occurred on July 15, 2019, and he was continued in SHU. Weekly record reviews commenced after the initial 7-day review. A 7-day review was conducted on July 19, 2019, and he remained in SHU. Further reviews were scheduled for July 26, 2019, and the process involved ongoing medical and officer observations, documentation, and assessments.

Jeffrey Edward Epstein, born July 11, 2019, is a single male of White/Hispanic ethnicity. His USMS number is EFTA00022542. He was arrested on July 20, 2019, for a trafficking conspiracy and a sex offense. His FBI number is redacted. He is currently awaiting trial and has no known aliases, vehicles, or financial information available. His origin police identification number is redacted.

On July 18, 2019, an Associate Warden (O) from FCI Estill sent an email regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054). The email stated that Epstein was not granted bail and returned from court without incident.

On July 18, 2019, Associate Warden (O) from FCI Estill reported that Jeffrey Epstein was not granted bail and returned from court without incident. The communication is marked as CONFIDENTIAL and includes reference to case numbers SDNY_00008957 and EFTA00033635.

On July 18, 2019, an Associate Warden at FCI Estill informed recipients that Jeffrey Edward Epstein was not granted bail and returned from court without incident. The email chain details this information and expresses surprise at the outcome.
On July 18, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was not granted bail and returned from court without incident. The communication was sent by an Associate Warden (O) regarding case EFTA00035468.

On July 18, 2019, Associate Warden (O) from FCI Estill communicated that Jeffrey Epstein was not granted bail and returned from court without incident. The communication was sent to [REDACTED] and referenced case number SDNY_00012513 and Epstein’s registration number 76318-054.

On July 18, 2019, an Associate Warden at FCI Estill sent an email regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054). The email stated that Epstein was not granted bail and returned from court without incident. The email included contact information for FCI Estill.

Jeffrey Edward Epstein, inmate #76318-054, presented to Health Services on 07/23/2019 due to an injury reported at approximately 01:27. He reported an unknown injury, stating he “just went to drink a little water and wake up snorting.” Examination revealed a circular erythema around his neck (2/3 circumference, 2 inches wide) with friction marks, and a small erythema on his left knee. He was found in his cell with a rope around his neck and sitting on the floor.  He appeared cooperative and denied pain. He was placed on suicide watch, scheduled for follow-up with psychology services and a Sick Call visit. The assessment noted a possible self-inflicted injury.

Jeffrey Edward Epstein, inmate #76318-054 at NYM facility, presented to Health Services on 07/23/2019 due to an injury reported at 01:27. The injury involves a circular erythema on his neck (approximately 2 inches wide and 2/3 of the circumference) and a small erythema on his left knee. He reports not knowing how the neck injury occurred, stating he was "snorting" when it happened. He denies pain or respiratory issues.  He was found with a rope around his neck and sitting on the floor.  He is currently placed on suicide watch and scheduled for follow-up with psychology services. The assessment is for unspecified self-inflicted injuries, and the plan includes follow-up at Sick Call, continued suicide watch, and a plan of care discussion with the provider.

Jeffrey Edward Epstein, inmate #76318-054 at NYM, presented to Health Services on 07/23/2019 due to an injury reported at 01:27 that evening. He stated he doesn’t know how the injury occurred, describing it as “just going to drink a little water and wake up snorting.” Examination revealed a circular erythema on his neck, approximately 2 inches wide and sparing the back of his neck, alongside a smaller erythema on his left knee. He was found with a rope around his neck and sitting on the floor by custody staff.  He was placed on suicide watch, assessed for self-inflicted injuries (T1490), and scheduled for follow-up with psychology services. The provider documented patient understanding of the plan of care and access to care.

This document is a Special Housing Unit SRO Review Roster from the U.S. Department of Justice, Federal Bureau of Prisons, pertaining to inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg No 7631e.C54). The roster includes inmate name, registration number, IA date, status (PENDING CLASSIFICATION), review dates, and reasons for review. It indicates a review due on 07-26-2019 with a confidential status (SDNY_00011514). The document also includes past-due AD and PD orders for other inmates.

Department of Justice, Federal Bureau of Prisons, New York MCC. *   **Inmate:** Jeffrey Edward Epstein, Case Number 76318.054, Team Taskworker. *   **Cell:** Cell 5, Special Housing Unit Cell Number 204.206E-0D. *   **Admission Date:** 2019-07-29 *   **Medical Information:** Inmate is on medication, with notes regarding epilepsy and diabetes. *   **Shift Logs:** Records daily shift logs including meals, exercise, out-of-cell time, and medical staff observations. *   **Medical Observations:** Between 2019-07-29 and 2019-08-02, the inmate reports no medical complaints. *   **Form Version:** This is a revised version of BP.292(52), replacing the August 2011 version.

Jeffrey Edward Epstein is in Administrative Detention at New York MCC, effective 07-29-2019 12:21, due to pending investigations including a Bureau regulation violation, SIS investigation, and potential criminal activity. The detention is based on staff perception of a serious threat to safety and security. He is also in holdover status during a transfer and pending classification. The order remains in effect until further notice, with a 24-hour review scheduled by the supervisor. Copies of the order are distributed to various units including the Administrative Detention Unit, Psychology, and Central File.

Jeffrey Edward Epstein was placed in Administrative Detention at New York MCC on July 29, 2019, due to several pending investigations and concerns regarding a serious threat to safety. These include a violation of Bureau regulations, an SIS investigation, a criminal investigation, a request for protection from the inmate himself, and a perceived threat to the institution’s security. The Correctional Supervisor determined Epstein’s continued presence in the general population posed a serious threat and ordered placement until further notice. The order was documented and disseminated to relevant staff and departments.

Inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Register Number 76318-064) was placed in the Special Housing Unit at New York MCC on 07-29-2019 due to a pending DHO for Code 228 (self-mutilation). A 3-day review on 08-01-2019 continued the placement. Weekly record reviews were scheduled, including daily medical staff observations and documentation. A 7-day review occurred on 08-05-2019, continuing the placement. There is a requirement for a psychiatric/psychological assessment after 30 days, and subsequent assessments monthly. The next review is scheduled for 08-12-2019.

On August 1, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was undergoing a series of court appearances and meetings, including an attorney conference. A psychological evaluation (SRA) was conducted on August 1st, initiated due to a note indicating suicidal tendencies, which was assessed by a Dr. Findings determined he was psychologically stable. Following the evaluation, he was taken off psych ops with a standard suicide risk assessment conducted the following day. Correspondence related to this activity was sent from FCI Estill.

This redaction analysis concerns the case of Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054). A correspondence dated August 10, 2019, detailing an updated timeline related to EFTA00036659 is present.  Attachments, including a .htm file and a .docx document, are associated with this correspondence.

Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054_1) was the subject of an email sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] on August 10, 2019. The email announced the sender’s absence from August 9-19, 2019, and designated specific staff members to handle responsibilities during that time: Dr. [REDACTED], Dr. [REDACTED], and Dr. [REDACTED]. An updated timeline was attached to the email.

This document is an email update regarding the timeline of investigations involving Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054). It includes two redaction notations and attachments named “TEXT.htm” and “Epstein, Jeffrey Edward, Reg. No. 73618-054_1.docx”. The email is sent from an unknown sender to NYM/Executive Staff@bop.gov and is marked as CONFIDENTIAL.

On August 10, 2019, the Associate Warden of MCC New York sent an email attachment, a "bog" (likely referring to a logbook), regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein’s case (Reg. No. 73618-054). The email confirms receipt of the logbook for potential future use and includes contact information for the Associate Warden.

An email was sent on August 10, 2019, regarding Jeffrey Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054_1) and an updated timeline. The email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED], and includes the document Eostein, Jeffrey Edward, Req. No. 73618-054 1.docx as an attachment. The email indicates the document is confidential and associated with case SDNY_000 10748.

This document pertains to Jeffrey Edward Epstein, Registration Number 73618-054, and includes a modified copy of his document. It’s a confidential communication from the Associate Warden of MCC New York to an unidentified recipient, dated August 10, 2019, with contact information for the facility. The document is labeled with case identifiers including SDNY_000 10732 and EFTA00034337.

This document is a confidential communication, sent on August 10, 2019, regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg # 76318-054). It originates from the Bureau of Prisons, specifically the MCC New York, and involves a clinical encounter finalized with a document named “TEXT.htm” and “ClinicalEncounterFinalizeGetDocument.faces.pdf”. The communication is labeled as CONFIDENTIAL and includes case numbers SDNY_000 13092 and EFTA00035006.

A Clinical Nurse Specialist from the Department of Justice, Bureau of Prisons – MCC New York, sent an email to an unidentified recipient on August 10, 2019, regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg 8: 76318-059). The email is attached to a file named “TEXT” and originates from the Department of Justice.

An email correspondence, dated August 10, 2019, pertains to Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054_1) and includes an updated timeline. The email is marked as CONFIDENTIAL and associated with case number SDNY_00011167. It references attached documents: TEXT.htm and Epstein, Jeffrey Edward, Req. No. 73618-054 1.docx.  “mc” is referenced as a contact for questions.

On August 10, 2019, an individual visited Jeffrey Epstein in SHU, noting he was preparing to meet with his attorneys. Epstein interacted with a cellmate, denied mental health concerns and suicidal thoughts, requested social calls without a speakerphone, and wanted a book from suicide watch. His mood was reported as not depressed or anxious, with no signs of distress. The visit occurred in MCC New York.

On August 10, 2019, inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein, 66, died at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York from an apparent suicide. He was found unresponsive in his cell and transported to a local hospital where he was pronounced dead. The FBI is investigating the incident, which occurred after Epstein’s arrival at the facility on July 6, 2019, following an indictment for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy. The MCC New York houses 763 male offenders.

On August 10, 2019, inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein, 66, was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York and pronounced dead at a local hospital from an apparent suicide. He was indicted on sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy charges and had been incarcerated since July 6, 2019. The FBI is investigating the incident. The MCC New York houses 763 male offenders.

On August 10, 2019, inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein was found unresponsive at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York and later died at a local hospital due to life-threatening injuries. He was 66 years old and incarcerated on pretrial status for sex trafficking charges. No staff or other inmates were injured, and the FBI was notified. The MCC New York houses 763 male offenders.

The report details his movements and assignments from August 10, 2019, through the time of creation (December 25, 2025). Key details include: *   **Initial Admission:**  He was admitted on August 10, 2019, at 0747 from USM.  A pre-sent admit occurred on July 6, 2019, at 2124. *   **Court Appearances:** He had a court appearance scheduled for July 8, 2019, at 0920 with a return scheduled for 0747. *   **Housing Assignments:** He was assigned to various beds within the facility (Z/Range 04, 05, 02, 01, 06, and 547U) with specific dates and times of assignment and movement. *   **Assignments & Activities:** He had assignments including care level care, court appearances, SEX TRAFFICKING CONSP., SEX TRAFFICKING OF MINORS,  guard duty, and supervision ( SECUR THRT RAPE H). There were multiple assignments associated with “Attorney Visit” at various times. *   **No Discipline Record:** There are no disciplinary records (as of August 10, 2019) listed in the chronological log. *   **No Current Sentence Data:** There are no current or prior sentence data details recorded. *   **Further Investigation:** The report notes the existence of ongoing investigation related to sex trafficking. The document is part of a series of NYMHM reports (533.01) providing assignment history.  The report is incomplete; it indicates that more pages were to follow.

This document is a redacted communication concerning Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. #76318-054). It originates from the Department of Justice, specifically a Clinical Nurse Specialist at the 131 Weatt of Prisons NR'C New York facility, referencing an emergency Code EPSTEIN and associated files including “TEXT.htm” and “ClinicalEncounterFinalizeGetDocument.faces.pdf.” The communication is classified as CONFIDENTIAL and includes case number SDNY_000 11470.

On August 10, 2019, Jeffrey Edward Epstein was pronounced dead at New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital due to an apparent suicide. The U.S. Department of Justice, Federal Bureau of Prisons, Office of the Warden sent condolences to Mark Epstein regarding his brother’s death.
This document is an email update regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054_1) and attachment No. 73618.054 1.do, sent on August 10, 2019, from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED].

On August 10, 2019, inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein was found unresponsive at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York and later died at a local hospital from life-threatening injuries. He was 66 years old and was being held pretrial on sex trafficking charges. No staff or other inmates were injured, and the public was not in danger. The FBI was notified.

On August 10, 2019, inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York and pronounced dead at a local hospital due to an apparent suicide. He was 66 years old and incarcerated on sex trafficking and conspiracy charges. The FBI is investigating the incident. The MCC New York facility houses 763 male offenders.

This document is an emergency report regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg # 76318-054) dated August 10, 2019. It was generated on December 27, 2025, and includes attachments named TEXT.htm and ClinicalEncounterFinalizeGetDocument.faces.pdf. The report originates from the Bureau of Patient Control in New York.

On August 10, 2019, Jeffrey Edward Epstein was pronounced dead at New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital due to an apparent suicide. The U.S. Department of Justice’s Federal Bureau of Prisons sent a condolence letter to Mr. Epstein regarding his brother’s death.

On August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:33 am, a medical emergency was reported in the 9South Special Housing Unit. A senior officer responded and found medical staff performing CPR on Jeffrey Edward Epstein (#76318-054), who was unresponsive. The officer assisted in transporting Epstein to the Health Service Area, where CPR continued until EMS staff arrived. The inmate was then transported by ambulance with Bop staff escort to Downtown Beckman hospital, where the officer remained on post until relieved.

On August 10, 2019, the U.S. Marshals Service confirmed the death of Jeffrey Edward Epstein, 66, a federal prisoner. Epstein was held at the BOP’s Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York and was being investigated by the FBI. The U.S. Marshals Service partners with various entities, including state and local governments, the Federal Bureau of Prisons, and private detention facilities, to house its prisoner population.

On August 10, 2019, Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg# 76318-054) at NYM facility experienced a medical emergency involving cardiac arrest. Initial responders, including correctional officers, initiated CPR. Medical personnel (RN, paramedics) arrived and performed advanced life support, including intubation, epinephrine administration, and IV fluids. The inmate was unresponsive, exhibiting fixed and dilated pupils, circumferential bruising around the neck, and mottled skin. Despite interventions, the inmate was transported to a local ER with ongoing CPR. A consultation request for an Emergency Room and translator was initiated.

On August 10, 2019, inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein, 66, died at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York from an apparent suicide. He was found unresponsive in his cell and transported to a local hospital where he was pronounced dead. Epstein was being held on pretrial status for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy, having arrived at the MCC on July 6, 2019. The FBI is investigating the incident.

This document is a clinical encounter finalized regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg # 76318-054) within the MCC New York facility, Department of Justice, Bureau of Prisons. It was sent on August 10, 2019, and is marked as confidential, referencing case number SDNY_00008855 and file EFTA00033610.

On August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:33 am, a body alarm was triggered at the 9.South unit, specifically cell #220, tier #11. Inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein (#76318-054) was found unresponsive and receiving CPR by medical staff. Staff subsequently moved the inmate to the medical room and continued CPR until paramedics arrived. The inmate was transported to a hospital via EMS vehicle, and the officer remained on-site until relieved.

On August 10, 2019, Jeffrey Edward Epstein, an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, was pronounced dead at New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital. The cause of death appears to be suicide, according to preliminary reports. The communication was sent by the Warden of the MCC New York to Mark Epstein, informing him of his brother’s death and expressing condolences.

On August 10, 2019, inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein, 66, was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York and died from an apparent suicide. He was found in the Special Housing Unit at approximately 6:30 a.m. EMS was called, and he was transported to a local hospital where he was pronounced dead. Epstein was being held under pretrial status for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy, having arrived at the MCC on July 6, 2019. The FBI is investigating the incident. The MCC New York is an Administrative security facility housing 763 male offenders.

It includes: *   **Inmate History:** A detailed record of his housing assignments (rooms and beds) from July 2019 through August 10, 2019, with dates and times of assignments. *   **Category:** QTR (likely meaning quarters), indicating a standard housing assignment. *   **Function:** FCL (likely referring to a specific function or program). *   **Discipline Data:** A chronological record of disciplinary actions (though none exist within the timeframe covered). *   **Security/Designation Data:** Information regarding his security level (W/M/66), offense (sex trafficking of minors), and custody classification, including his medical and psychological status. *   **Inmate Profile:** A comprehensive profile detailing his personal information (birthdate, address, etc.), program assignments, and other relevant details. *   **TRUVIEW Report:** A report documenting his interactions, including money received and sent, calls, and visits, from May 11, 2020. The document appears to be part of a larger system for tracking inmate information within the Federal Bureau of Prisons.

The United States District Court, Southern District of New York, is conducting a deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell as part of a lawsuit involving the estates of Jeffrey Edward Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The deposition is scheduled for April 29, 2020, at 10:00 a.m. Eastern Time, and will be recorded via video, audio, and stenographic means. Counsel for the plaintiff, Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, and counsel for the defendants, N FOREMAN P.C. and TROUTMAN ANDERS LLP, have been notified via electronic mail.

It’s a memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, regarding inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054), who is accused of attempted self-harm (tattooing or self-mutilation – code 228). The report outlines a series of requests for data collection, including assessments of his competency to proceed with disciplinary action (PP44, PSDC, PSDG, PSSD, PDI5, PD16), and determines that no sanctions are currently executable.  The report also contains a clinical encounter report from a psychologist, assessing the inmate's mental state, and incident reports detailing the attempted suicide, including photographs and statements from staff and the inmate, including details about a cellmate's accusations of harassment. The document also includes a file of data related to the inmate’s sentence, including good conduct time data.

Jeffrey Edward Epstein (born 01/20/1953), a Black male inmate at MCC-NY, was assessed on 07/08/2019 due to a recent arrival. He is incarcerated for sex trafficking and previously incarcerated for prostitution. He denies a history of mental health treatment or symptoms, including suicidal ideation.  His psychosocial history includes a single status, high school education, and prior banking employment. Initial assessment revealed "Other" psychosocial issues and a calm, cooperative demeanor.  He was categorized as CARE1-MH (low risk), indicating no significant functional impairment.  Risk of sexual abusiveness was identified due to a history of sexual predation and violent offenses, leading to recommendations for continued monitoring and potentially specialized programming. A general administrative note highlighted heightened suicide risk concerns due to his legal situation and mandated immediate notification to psychology staff upon his return from court.

He was initially seen on 07/27/2019 reporting anxiety related to past SHU experiences, memory issues, and concerns about his neck marks.  Subsequent entries (07/28-07/31) documented ongoing observation, including issues with sleep, numbness, a concerning incident with a toilet, and questions about his accommodations. The prison psychologist provided supportive interventions and coping strategies, including handouts and educating him on procedures.  A suicide risk assessment was conducted on 07/23/2019 (and repeated on 08/01/2019), finding a low overall risk with protective factors present. A final assessment on 08/08/2019 noted his general well-being and continued monitoring with weekly rounds and monthly SHU reviews.  He was initially flagged due to a concern about a string around his neck, but the source of the marks remains unclear.

Jeffrey Edward Epstein (DOB 01/20/1953) was referred for a competency evaluation regarding a charge of tattooing/self-mutilation (code 228, incident report 3282555).  A suicide risk assessment from 7/09/19 indicated no history of mental health treatment, suicidal ideation, intention, or self-harm behavior. A subsequent assessment on 7/23/19 was unclear about how he obtained marks around his neck.  His mental status exam revealed a neutral mood, coherent speech, and no hallucinations or delusions.  He denied current suicidal or self-harm ideation and agreed to report such thoughts.  The determination is that he is competent to proceed with the disciplinary process.

The initial assessment, conducted by the Chief Psychologist, revealed a history of denying mental health treatment, substance abuse, and self-harm.  He denied suicidal ideation, intention, or plans.  His current mental status was alert, oriented, and cooperative. He exhibited normal psychomotor activity, general appearance, and mood.  Risk factors included the high-profile case and legal situation.  The assessment concluded with a low acute suicide risk and an absent chronic suicide risk, leading to a CARE1-MH classification (indicating minimal need for intervention). The final note reiterates the classification and recommends continued observation.

He was initially seen for a suicide risk assessment. He denied any history of mental health treatment, suicidal ideation, substance abuse, or self-harm.  The assessment found no acute psychopathology or current suicidal risk. He was classified as a CC1-MH inmate, indicating minimal functional impairment and no need for regular mental health intervention.  Recommendations included continued observation and placement in a suitable housing unit.  The overall acute and chronic suicide risk was deemed Low and Absent, respectively.

He is 66 years old, 6’0” tall, and has blue eyes and gray hair. *   **Operation Location:** The operation is planned for two locations: Teterboro Airport (NJ) and New York, NY. The target premises is a nearly 19,000 square foot multi-story single-family residence. *   **Site Survey:** The location is described as a residence with specific details like a red door and potential escape routes. *   **Vehicle:** A 2016 Black Chevrolet Suburban (License Plate HCP5713) is associated with the subject. *   **Operation Details:** A silent hit notification has been placed for Epstein’s return to the US. The planned arrest involves coordination between FBI, NYPD, and CBP, with a subsequent search warrant execution. *   **Personnel Assignments:** A team of FBI and NYPD personnel are assigned various roles, including command, arrest, search, transport, and interviews. *   **Communications:** Communications protocols and contact information for various agencies and a confidential source are listed. *   **Policy:** The FBI Deadly Force Policy dictates that deadly force is permissible only when there is a reasonable belief of imminent death or serious bodily injury.

The encounter was a 14-day physician evaluation related to several chronic conditions.  He presented with hyperlipidemia, hypertension, and a history of sleep apnea (using a CPAP machine). He reported severe lower extremity pain, likely caused by spinal stenosis, and had been taking Medrol for this.  He also had a history of triglyceride elevations for which he discontinued Vascepa due to side effects.  During the encounter, physical exams revealed normal findings except for the pain, obesity, and abnormalities in his back. The provider ordered magnesium hydroxide for constipation, methylprednisolone for neuralgia, and continued existing medications. Subsequent encounters (July 7 and 9, 2019) involved further laboratory testing (including A1C, lipid profile, CMP, and urinalysis) and continued monitoring of his conditions, plus documentation of patient education.  The encounter concluded with no specific changes to his medications, except for the addition of magnesium hydroxide, and scheduled follow-up appointments.
